item.description:
This is NO LONGER a call for volunteers (although still accepted!), but simply an announcement of an inexpensive, family-friendly "Country Fair".

A one-day afFAIR, THIS SATURDAY, September 29, 10AM to 4PM.

This is an old-fashioned Country Fair (hay wagon & pony rides, flower, veggie, art, and baking competitions, box lunch auction, various crafters & demonstrations, w/ lots of food, etc., but it is alcohol-free and there are no noisy amusement park rides. This is a non-profit fundraiser (all food, etc. proceeds are donated) that exposes this jewel of a nature park to the public.

>>> Admission is only $2/Adults and $1/Kids, parking is free, and most activities & competitions are free, or charge a nominal fee to cover expenses. Whether volunteering or not, feel free to enjoy this very inexpensive, fun, and wholesome event with your kids or grandkids!

Of particular interest to young children (pre-K through Grade 8), I Chair the *Kid's Fun & Games* aspect of the Fair: Pumpkin Carving & Pumpkin Decorating, Bubble Wands, Treasure Hunt in the Hay Stacks, Bead Jewelry making, "Fishing" Pond, Greased (soapy)Pole climb, etc., as well as competitions for pre-K through Middle School: Pie-Eating, Sack Race, 3-Legged Race, Water-Balloon toss, and *Tug-O-War* over Mud Pit! Following these FREE competitions, I award prizes for ALL participants and extra gifts and ribbons to the top three competitors of each event. I've organized a great team of Volunteers to ensure these events run safely and smoothly!

This will be a BEAUTIFUL day to enjoy with your young children or grand-children... there's pleanty of fun for adults, too - especially if you enjoy Crafters, eating, music, a wholesome ambiance, taking great photos, and 500 acres of hiking trails!

No need to RSVP - just show up! (Unless volunteering, then email me directly).

Warmest Regards,

- Rob

Rob Pudney

Northwest Park is located at 145 Lang Road in Windsor, Connecticut 06095.

item.name: Northwest Park Country Fair - WINDSOR
